channel.title: Character Files, Not a Noob Question
channel.description:
Is there anyway to make the charcter file be called from a website database instead of the character folder in your server files? I want to know so I can have more then "1 World" On My server because I can't always host it.. =[
Ikill, I see your on, Please Help me lol :|[br][size=1]Posted on: March 16, 2007, 08:51:55 AM[/size][hr]Could someone please help with this?

item.title: Character Files, Not a Noob Question
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

[quote=“tim_moughtin, post:4, topic:68329”][quote author=NewbieNewty link=topic=99975.msg1019828#msg1019828 date=1174082059]

Is there anyway to make the charcter file be called from a website database instead of the character folder in your server files?
I want to know so I can have more then “1 World” On My server because I can’t always host it… =[

Ikill, I see your on, Please Help me lol :|[br][size=1]Posted on: March 16, 2007, 08:51:55 AM[/size][hr]Could someone please help with this?

no i don’t thin kits possible. you want more than one world on your server?

I don’t want to host the whole thing from the website. Just the character files. I know it is possible because you can make a client, for example, call it’s background from the web, so why not be able to do the same with character files?
Kind of… I’ve sen it just recently, RS3.Servergame.Com has more then 1 world and the character files instantly transfer from 1 “World” To another… Also PkIsle is ran through a website… Please help…
[/quote]

well if its ran through a website, it means the site is acting as a server, so i suppose mre than one world is possible.

if i were you id look into hosting sevrers from websites, then see if you can do the same, as far as i know, you could host it from a website, but would be complicated[/quote]

Read full topic
item.source: Character Files, Not a Noob Question
